alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 05 at 4:55PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 454 PM CDT, trained weather spotters (NWS employee) reported heavy rain in Brownsville due to thunderstorms. Minor street flooding was reported at the intersection of Boca Chica Boulevard and Security Drive. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Brownsville is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rancho Viejo, Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Olmito, Southmost, Port Of Brownsville, La Paloma, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, Brownsville Event Center, Vela Middle School, Brownsville Golf Center, Northside Transfer Station, Gallegos Elementary School, Sunrise Mall, Valley Regional Medical Center, Hanna High School, B I S D Administration Building, Brownsville Public Library Main Branch and Pullam Elementary School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
